title: Horsell Common Walking Route

images.caption: Heathland and birch tree, Horsell Common

images.title: David Hawgood / Pond and sandpit, Horsell Common - site for "The War of the Worlds"
images.caption: Pond and sandpit - site for "The War of the Worlds" by H.G. Wells, a "shooting star" falls: "It's out on Horsell Common now. Good Lord! said Henderson. Fallen meteorite! Thats good. But its something more than a meteorite. Its a cylinder --an artificial cylinder, man! And theres something inside."

images.title: Colin Smith / Woking's Martian.
images.caption: Woking's Martian. Close-up detail of the metal sculpture in Chobham Road, Woking.

images.title: Horsell Common, Woking by Colin Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Colin Smith / Woking - Peace Memorial Garden
images.caption: Peace Memorial Garden. Refurbished 2015, this garden was formerly known as the Muslim Burial Ground and dedicated to all the Muslim soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in WW1 and WW2.

description: This 880 acre common in Woking is a great place for a peaceful walk. There are miles of woodland walking paths, a number of Bronze Age barrows, wet areas, ponds and protected heathland. Look out for birdlife which includes nightjar, woodlark and Dartford warbler. The common is famous for its sand pits which were used by H.G. Wells as the site of the first Martian landing in his novel The War of the Worlds. To extend your walking in the area you can head to the pretty Goldsworth Park Lake or pick up the Basingstoke Canal .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Heather Farm Cafe is located on the common. They sell a delicous range of snacks and treats with afternoon tea also available. You can find them on Chobham Road with postcode GU21 4XY for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The common is a fine place for dog walking so you'll probably see plenty of other owners on your visit. They are not allowed in the fenced wetland area and easy access path around the pond and waterfowl nesting areas at Heather Farm. The Heather Farm Cafe mentioned above is dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Surrey Walks page.

display_address: Six Crossroads Roundabout, Sheerwater, Woking, Surrey, England, GU21 5SH, United Kingdom
